Welcome to the Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics course. This textbook will guide you through the journey of bridging the gap between digital intelligence and physical embodiment.
The Convergence of LLMs and Robotics
Physical AI is computationally demanding. It involves Physics Simulation, Visual Perception, and Generative AI.
NVIDIA Isaac Sim requires RTX (Ray Tracing) capabilities. Standard laptops will not work.
GPU: NVIDIA RTX 4070 Ti (12GB VRAM) or higher. CPU: Intel Core i7 (13th Gen+) or AMD Ryzen 9. RAM: 64 GB DDR5 (32 GB minimum). OS: Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (Native or Dual Boot).
For physical deployment, we recommend: Brain: NVIDIA Jetson Orin Nano (8GB) or Orin NX (16GB). Eyes: Intel RealSense D435i or D455 (with IMU). Voice: USB Microphone/Speaker array.
Budget: Unitree Go2 Edu (~$3,000) - Quadruped proxy. Intermediate: Unitree G1 (~$16,000) - Miniature Humanoid. Premium: Unitree H1 ($90k+).

âœ¨ Personalize for MeðŸ‡µðŸ‡° Ø§Ø±Ø¯Ùˆ Ù…ÛŒÚº Ù¾Ú‘Ú¾ÛŒÚº Welcome to the Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics course. This textbook will guide you through the journey of bridging the gap between digital intelligence and physical embodiment.

Physical AI refers to AI systems that function in reality and comprehend physical laws. Unlike traditional AI that operates in digital spaces (like chatbots or recommendation engines), Physical AI is embodied in robots that can move, perceive, and interact with the real world.

Bridge the Gap: Connect digital brains with physical bodies. Embodied Intelligence: Apply AI knowledge to control Humanoid Robots. Real-world Application: Use industry-standard tools like ROS 2, Gazebo, and NVIDIA Isaac.

The Robotic Nervous System (ROS 2): Middleware for robot control. The Digital Twin (Gazebo & Unity): Physics simulation and environment building. The AI-Robot Brain (NVIDIA Isaacâ„¢): Advanced perception and training. Vision-Language-Action (VLA): Convergence of LLMs and Robotics. Let's begin our journey into the future of work!

ROS 2 (Robot Operating System) is an open-source middleware suite for robot software development. It provides the services you would expect from an operating system, including hardware abstraction, low-level device control, implementation of commonly-used functionality, message-passing between processes, and package management.
A Node is a process that performs computation. Each node should be responsible for a single module (e.g., controlling motors, processing laser scans).
Topics are a vital element of the ROS graph that act as a bus for nodes to exchange messages. They follow a publish-subscribe pattern.
Services are another method of communication in ROS. They follow a call-and-response pattern, where a client sends a request and a server sends a response.
Actions are intended for long-running tasks. They have three parts: a goal, feedback, and a result.
Humanoid robots have many degrees of freedom and sensors. ROS 2 allows us to manage this complexity through a distributed architecture.

Simulation allows us to test robot controllers in a safe, controlled environment before deploying them to real hardware. This is especially important for humanoid robots, where falls can be expensive.
Gazebo is a 3D dynamic simulator with the ability to accurately and efficiently simulate populations of robots in complex indoor and outdoor environments.
Physics Engine: Handles gravity, collisions, and rigid body dynamics. Sensors: Simulates LiDAR, Depth Cameras, and IMUs. Plugins: Allows you to control the simulation programmatically.

URDF (Unified Robot Description Format): An XML format for representing a robot model. SDF (Simulation Description Format): An XML format that describes objects and environments for simulation and visualization.
Simulating a walking humanoid requires balancing multiple joints and forces. Gazebo's physics engine helps us understand the dynamics of balance.
Isaac Sim is a robotics simulation application and synthetic data generation tool. It leverages NVIDIA Omniverseâ„¢ to provide photorealistic, physically accurate, and high-performance simulations.
Isaac ROS is a collection of hardware-accelerated packages that make it easier for ROS developers to build high-performance solutions on NVIDIA hardware.
VSLAM (Visual SLAM): Real-time visual odometry and mapping. NVIDIA Isaac Manipulator: Accelerated libraries for robotic arms. Nav2 Integration: Accelerated path planning for navigation.
The goal of using Isaac Sim is often Sim-to-Real transferâ€”training an AI model in simulation and then deploying it to a physical robot with minimal adjustments.
The future of robotics involves robots that can understand natural language and translate it into physical actions. This is referred to as Vision-Language-Action (VLA) modeling.
documents.s: The Convergence of LLMs and Robotics

documents.t: We can use OpenAI Whisper to transcribe human voice commands into text, which can then be processed by an LLM-based agent.

An LLM can act as a high-level planner, breaking down a command like "Go to the kitchen and bring me a cup" into a sequence of ROS 2 actions: Navigate to 'kitchen' waypoint. Search for 'cup' using Computer Vision. Plan grasp trajectory. Execute grasp. Navigate back to 'user'.
In the final project, you will implement a simulated humanoid that receives a voice command, plans its path, navigates obstacles, and interacts with objects.
